segments.text: The comments mention that the cache should have a maximum size of 100 and entries should expire 10 minutes after writing.

segments.text: So, I remember that in Caffeine, you use Caffeine.newBuilder() to start building the cache. Then you chain the configuration methods. The maximum size is set with maximumSize(100).

segments.text:
For expiration, after writing, it's expireAfterWrite with the time and unit. So 10 minutes would be 10, TimeUnit. MINUTES. Then you call build() at the end. Putting that together, the missing line should be:

Caffeine.newBuilder()
        .maximumSize(100)
        .expireAfterWrite(10, TimeUnit.MINUTES)
        .build(); Wait, I need to check if the order matters. I think the order of the methods doesn't affect the configuration here. So yes, that's correct. The code starts the builder, sets the max size, sets expiration, and builds. That should be the correct setup for the cache as per the comments.

original_reasoning:
Okay, let's see. The task is to fill in the missing code for building the Caffeine cache in Java. The comments mention that the cache should have a maximum size of 100 and entries should expire 10 minutes after writing.

So, I remember that in Caffeine, you use Caffeine.newBuilder() to start building the cache. Then you chain the configuration methods. The maximum size is set with maximumSize(100). For expiration, after writing, it's expireAfterWrite with the time and unit. So 10 minutes would be 10, TimeUnit.MINUTES. Then you call build() at the end.

Putting that together, the missing line should be:

Caffeine.newBuilder()
        .maximumSize(100)
        .expireAfterWrite(10, TimeUnit.MINUTES)
        .build();

Wait, I need to check if the order matters. I think the order of the methods doesn't affect the configuration here. So yes, that's correct. The code starts the builder, sets the max size, sets expiration, and builds. That should be the correct setup for the cache as per the comments.
